title: Google app Discover adds "www.google.com/amp/s/" in front of URL
content:
The Google app's Discover gives me a news feed (provided as cards) when I swipe to the left from the Pixel home.

Selecting any one of the cards opens the appropriate website in the browser (I've set Settings > General > Browser settings > Open web pages in Google app > off).

Recently, the app has started a new trick. When opening the website, it adds www.google.com/amp/s/ to the front. For example, for the URL
https://amp.classicfm.com/composers/beethoven/fur-elise-intervals-inverted/
the app opens the browser to
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.classicfm.com/composers/beethoven/fur-elise-intervals-inverted/

This is highly irritating, because it means that the target website cannot access its own cookies. I have to repeatedly accept the cookies warning, and log into the websiteâ€¦ Again.

It also adds a thin full-width card at the top of the page showing the website that it opened (see the attached screenshot). This adds to the irritation, because it means that when I scroll down, the top URL bar is prevented from disappearing as it's supposed to do.

My workaround, which is a pain to have to keep doing, is to let Google app Discover open the website, edit the URL, scroll to the left, and remove www.google.com/amp/s/ from the URL.

Curiously, Google app doesn't do this with every website, but it does do so with the vast majority of them. I cannot discern a pattern, why it does most but skips a few.

How can I turn off this new "feature", please?
